description.hltext_display: No laughing matter....
description.author: Mark Shenton
description.content:
Before it even opened, there were stories of actors suffering from injuries (broken wrists, broken feet) trying to execute and rehearse its flying stunts, once in front of a group sales presentation audience. Michael Riedel, the New York Post theatre columnist who has documented these events with unsparing detail, quickly redubbed the show, Spider-man, Please Sign my cast.
Then it began previews - and at the very first stop-start fraught performance, which I actually attended and reported on here, leading Spider-lady Natalie Mendoza was at one point caught in a web, literally, and held suspended above the stage in full view of the audience as they sought to get her moving again; that turned out to be a safer place to be than in the wings, where it was subsequently reported, she was hit by a rope that same evening as she stood waiting to go on and suffered a concussion that took her out of the show for a couple of weeks thereafter.
And now, and most dangerously and damagingly of all, 31-year-old Christopher Tierney who plays one of Spider-man’s stunt-doubles was badly injured in a fall from the set near the end of Monday evening’s performance and taken to the hospital, where he is said now to be in a serious condition. The moment itself was bizarrely caught by a member of the audience who was illegally filming it, and is posted in the New York Times story on the event here. In this new age of citizen journalism, the show had 1,800 potential reporters to tell the world what they had seen, and many did straight away, on Twitter feeds and subsequent blog reports.
People (myself included) who like to follow the trajectory of musicals that are in trouble are often called ambulance chasers. That has become a literal fact here: there are pictures online of Mr Tierney being loaded into one outside the theatre, his body rigidly strapped onto the gurney and a brace around his neck.
Just days before this happened, the producers had already announced a further delay to the official opening, which had originally been scheduled for last night, then moved to January 11, and is (at the time of writing) now booked for February 7. This is to allow U2’s Bono and the Edge, who have written its score, to return from their current international tour and write a new number for the show, as it deals with its other narrative and score problems that have are also besetting it, but have been so far drowned out by the technical issues.
As Patrick Healy recently commented in the New York Times, as a result “the musical will now have a total of 10 weeks of preview performances, one of the longest stretches in Broadway history”, and wondered aloud whether it would go on to break the record for previews, previously held by the 1991 musical Nick and Nora which ran to 71 previews in all. It’s going to be a close-run thing now: after Monday’s accident, the production have pledged to put in new safety protocols, and have cancelled today’s matinee as a result, with performances due to resume tonight.
That accident is now being attributed to “human error”, and according to a statement from the show’s press representative Rick Miramontez, who currently has the hardest task of any publicist on Broadway, “The production knows exactly what happened at Monday’s performance, and it is being dealt with. This is a maneuver that has been done hundreds, if not a thousand times, without incident, and additional redundancies are being put into place to ensure that will never happen again.”
But with a show of this size and complexity - one that has seven stage managers (two production managers and five assistant managers); as Variety recently pointed out, “That’s two more than any other show in Broadway history”—who’s to say there aren’t fresh accidents waiting to happen?
And meanwhile it is the paying public who are funding the experimental process. Tickets for previews are no longer sold at a reduced price for most productions on Broadway (though portions of the audience will have secured their seats via web ticket offers), and as New York Post theatre critic Elisabeth Vincentelli recently observed, “I don’t mind previews per se, of course — just the practice of charging full price for a work in progress. Checking out the show as it’s being worked on then posting on All That Chat may amuse the hardcore contingent, but I doubt the majority of tourists — who bought 63% of Broadway tickets in 2009-2010 — pay any attention to backstage shenanigans. All they know is that they paid $130 for something that’s not ready. Does anybody ever buy a new car with only half the upholstery installed and then hear it just wasn’t quite finished but hey, you don’t mind, right?”
I guess there is now always the morbid possibility of watching an actor get injured, too. Musical theatre as a bloodsport: who’d have thought it? As someone tweeted to me yesterday, perhaps they could advertise it with the tagline, “Who will live, who will die?” But actually it is no laughing matter anymore. Though lots of red ink is being used to write the show (and about it), it is not a show that is worth spilling a single drop of red blood over.

description.hltext_display: Småpengar till frilansar
description.content:
Vimmerby Tidnings frilansar får 204 kronor för en artikel på 50-150 rader. Flera av frilansarna har jobb vid sidan av för att klara sig.
Linn Moberg är 21 år och har gått gymnasiets samhällslinje. Hon frilansar sedan i maj i 2009 åt Vimmerby Tidning. En bra månad kommer hon upp till en månadslön på 10 000 kronor efter skatt, men i november fick hon ihop
7 800 kronor för 25 artiklar.
– Jag skulle inte klara mig på bara journalistlönen. Därför jobbar jag också som personlig assistent, säger hon.
Några exempel på arvoden som Linn Moberg jobbar för:
Artikel 50-150 rader: 204 kronor
Artikel över 150 rader: 278 kronor
Notiser: 101 kronor
För en första bild betalar tidningen 96 kronor, för en andra bild 60 kronor och en tredje bild 37 kronor
Förstasidespuff + bild: 42 kronor
Jourtillägg för jul och nyår: 515 kronor
Arbetsgivaren drar av 30 procent i skatt.
Trots den låga ersättningen är Linn Moberg ganska nöjd.
– Jag är glad över att jag får arbetslivserfarenhet.
Enligt Vimmerby Tidnings redaktionschef Alf Wesik har man tillämpat detta system i 10-15 år.
– Våra frilansar har skrivit på avtal om de villkoren. Vi beräknar att våra frilansar utför så många journalistiska uppdrag att det till slut blir en bra, avtalsenlig lön.
Tar ni ingen hänsyn till tidsåtgång eller ämnenas svårighetsgrad?
– Nej, detta är vad som gäller för de medarbetare som vi regelbundet anlitar. Men för speciella uppdrag för andra frilansar skriver vi särskilda avtal.
Alf Wesik uppger att arvodena efter löneförhandlingar varje år höjs. Journalistklubben på tidningen hävdar att det betyder att redaktionschefen brukar justera upp arvodena med två-tre kronor varje år.
Redaktionschefen har inte svårt att hitta frilansar som accepterar att jobba under dessa villkor, som för övrigt gäller för alla tidningar inom samma tidningsgrupp, till exempel Ölandsbladet, Växjöbladet, Kalmar Läns Tidning och Ölandsbladet. Ett 30-tal frilansar jobbar åt tidningarna.
Enligt uppgift till Journalisten garanterar ni att annonserande företag ska slippa negativ publicitet?
– Det förnekar jag fullständigt.
Varför tror du att sådana påståenden framförs?
– Det beror på att det finns konkurrenter som är avundsjuka därför att det går bra för oss.
Åsa Ohlsson, ordförande i Frilans Riks är upprörd över hur låga arvoden Vimmerby Tidnings frilansar tvingas acceptera.
– Man blir bara så beklämd. Det är knappt man har ord för det. Räknar man efter måste de här frilansarna skriva så oerhört många artiklar att det ter sig overkligt att de ska kunna tjäna ihop till en anständig månadslön.
På Frilans Riks känner man till att det ser ut så här på en del landsortstidningar.
– Många av de lägst betalda är inte medlemmar i Journalistförbundet och har inte en tydlig yrkesidentitet. Frilansarna kan vända sig till Frilans Riks och till arbetsplatsklubbarna och be om hjälp. Håkan Lindqvist
Håkan Lindqvist
Namn
Kom ihåg
E-post (visas inte)

description.hltext_display: 100th AD: Assembly race nears finish line
description.content:
GOSHEN — The drawn-out race for New York’s 100th District Assembly seat could have a winner as early as today.
Republican challenger Thomas Kirwan of Newburgh currently leads incumbent Democrat Frank Skartados of Milton by 64 votes with 119 ballots remaining.
State Supreme Court Justice Victor Alfieri was expected to rule Tuesday on which of the remaining ballots could be opened and counted. The counting is likely today.
The 100th District, which includes parts of Ulster, Dutchess and Orange counties, was represented by Kirwan for 14 years until Skartados unseated him two years ago.
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »

description.hltext_display: Las obras de la guardería de la zona Sur se iniciarán en marzo
description.content:
La adjudicación provisional recae sobre Jovilma por 1,3 millones de euros
Mie, 22/12/2010
J. MAIQUES / Burgos
El proyecto de la guardería que se va a construir en la Zona Sur (junto al colegio Sierra de Atapuerca) acaba de cumplir con el que podría ser, si no hay recurso, el último trámite administrativo. Y es que el Consejo de Administración de la Gerencia Municipal de Servicios Sociales aprobó ayer la adjudicación provisional de la ejecución de las obras a la empresa Jovilma por un importe de 1,3 millones de euros. Una oferta que se ha situado en 150.000 euros por debajo del presupuesto base de licitación y que ha competido con otras 25 sociedades que han intentado hacerse con la obra.
De cumplirse los plazos previstos, las máquinas podrían empezar a trabajar sobre el terreno a los largo del primer trimestre del próximo año, tal y como señaló ayer a este periódico la concejala del área de Servicios Sociales del Ayuntamiento de Burgos, María José Abajo.
En cuanto a la escuela infantil que se construirá en Gamonal, todavía habrá que esperar a que se resuelva el concurso aunque, en cualquier caso, también está planificado que las obras comiencen, aunque después, a lo largo del próximo año.
Cada centro contará con siete aulas para 102 niños de entre cero y tres años de edad, repartidas en los cerca de 900 metros cuadrados de superficie con que contará cada una de las escuelas, ambas diseñadas para ocupar una sola planta. A las aulas se sumarán varias salas de reuniones para profesores, de éstos con los padres, baños adaptados, cocina, comedor, área de despachos y salas de juego y usos múltiples.
El papel de la Junta de Castilla y León en la construcción de las dos escuelas infantiles se expresa a través de una subvención que cubre, aproximadamente, el 80% del presupuesto de la obra. Una ayuda que no es excepcional ya que, con la guardería de Villalonquéjar ya se hizo lo mismo.
El espacio de construcción es una de las diferencias entre los dos proyectos. Así, mientras la guardería que se levantará en Gamonal Norte se realizará sobre una parcela cuadrada ubicada en la calle Averroes, entre el CEIS (Centro de Inserción Social) y el nuevo conservatorio de música, la segunda completará la parcela que ya ocupa el nuevo colegio Sierra de Atapuerca, junto a la calle Santa Dorotea de la Zona Sur.

description.hltext_display: SLRFU interviews Kandy SCs Taylor for coaching post
description.content:
The Sri Lanka Rugby Football Union (SLRFU) said it had already interviewed the coach of the champion Kandy Sports Club, Johan Taylor, as one of the candidates for the now vacant post of head coach of the national rugby team. SLRFU Secretary Shane Dullawe told ‘The Island’ that Dilip Kumar, a Sri Lankan domiciled in Australia, and one time national coach and technical adviser, George Simpkins, had been approached to help find a coach for the national rugby team.
The SLRFU plans to appoint a national head coach before the end of December with the view of preparing the players for the 2011 Asian 5 Nations tournament which will feature Japan, Arabian Gulf, Kazakhstan, Hong Kong and Sri Lanka.
The SLRFU has already appointed three assistant coaches to oversee training when the call goes out to the players to assemble for training.
Write Your Comment

description.hltext_display: デミチェリス、レンタル移籍でマラガへ
description.content: ［Goal.com］ スペイン『カデナ・コペ』によると、バイエルン・ミュンヘンに所属するアルゼンチン代表ＤＦマルティン・デミチェリスのマラガへのレンタル移籍が、ほぼ決定したようだ。『カデナ・コペ』は、マラガがデミチェリスを２０１１年６月までのレンタルで獲得することで、バイエルンと基本合意に至ったと報じた。マラガは３００万ユーロを支払うことで、デミチェリスを完全に買い取ることもできるようだ。デミチェリスの代理人は現地時間２１日にスペインに赴き、マラガと契約の条件面について話し合う予定だという。今季わずか１０試合の出場にとどまっているデミチェリスは、ルイス・ファン・ハール監督との間に確執があることから、退団を望んでいると報じられていた。

description.hltext_display: Haddonfield's Arruda commits to Richmond
description.author: Phil Anastasia
description.content:
"I just loved the feeling on that campus," Arruda said of her recent visit to the University of Richmond. "I knew it was the right place for me." Arruda, a senior swimming star at Haddonfield, has committed to Richmond and will swim for the Spiders.
Also, juniors Alana Barry and Julia Osisek of Eastern have made commitments to continue their field hockey careers at Division I programs.
Barry became the fifth Eastern player to commit to Iowa in the last three years, while Osisek committed to James Madison.
Arruda, a versatile swimmer who specializes in the 500 and 200 freestyle, has helped the Bulldogs to three consecutive South Jersey Public B titles and the 2009 Public B state title.
Haddonfield is a strong contender for both crowns again this season.
Arruda, who also swims for the Jersey Wahoos and Wedgewood Swim Club in Haddonfield, said she was attracted to Richmond's size, academic reputation, and improving swim team. "I go to a small school, and Richmond is a small school," Arruda said. "They have a great liberal arts program, but they are strong in a lot of areas, so I could switch to something else. "The swimming program is getting better and better, and I could see myself improving as a swimmer along with the team." Osisek was a top defender for an Eastern team that went 27-1 last season and won its 12th consecutive state Group 4 title. Her decision to attend James Madison was special to Eastern coach Danyle Heilig, a James Madison graduate. "I look forward to her senior year, but I know she's going to blossom as a 'Duke Dog,' " Heilig said. Barry is one of the state's top goalies. She had 20 shutouts last season and has 58 for her career. "Alana got an opportunity this season to demonstrate to the state of New Jersey what an outstanding goalie she is, not just a good goalie with an outstanding team in front of her," Heilig said. At Iowa, Barry likely will join Eastern graduates Geena Lesiak and Kelsey Mitchell and current Eastern seniors Cori Allen and Brittany Evangelisti, who have committed to Iowa.
Looking ahead to the fall of 2012, when five Eastern players could be on the Hawkeyes' roster, Heilig said, "Needless to say, I'll be taking a trip to Iowa that season." Contact staff writer Phil Anastasia at 856-779-3223 or panastasia@phillynews.com.

description.hltext_display: Оренбургский губернатор удерживает стабильное положение в рейтинге "Медиалогии"
description.content:
Губернатор Оренбуржья Юрий Берг. Коллаж: ИА REGNUM
Губернатор Оренбуржья Юрий Берг занял десятое - замыкающее - место в рейтинге Топ-10 глав регионов Приволжского федерального округа РФ по количеству сообщений в региональных СМИ, который провела компания "Медиалогия" в ноябре 2010 года, сообщает корреспондент ИА REGNUM. Стоит отметить, что положение оренбургского губернатора в рейтинге по сравнению с октябрем осталось неизменным. Разница появилась лишь в количестве информационных сообщений.
Так, в октябре Юрий Берг упомянут в 268 информационных сообщениях, а в ноябре - в 257. Добавим, что в сентябре губернатор Оренбуржья в рейтинге Топ-10 глав регионов Приволжского федерального округа РФ по количеству сообщений в региональных СМИ отсутствовал. Несмотря на то, что о главе Оренбуржья сообщалось достаточно, чтобы попасть в ТОП-лист, Юрий Берг не получил Индекс Информационного Благоприятствования ни в октябре, ни в ноябре. Аналогичная ситуация сложилась и в сентябре 2010 года, когда Юрий Берг занял 34 место в Топ-40 глав регионов РФ по количеству сообщений в региональных СМИ (430 сообщений), но опять же не вошел в ТОП-лист по Индексу Информационного Благоприятствования.
Напомним, что Индекс Информационного Благоприятствования (ИИБ) является показателем качественного состояния информационного поля, формируемого СМИ вокруг персоны. По мнению руководителя пресс-службы губернатора и правительства Оренбургской области Евгении Шевченко, стабильные позиции губернатора Оренбургской области в рейтинге ТОП-10 компании "Медиалогия" позволяют говорить о том, что Юрий Берг сохраняет свое присутствие в информационном поле на достаточно высоком уровне. "Устойчивый интерес к его персоне со стороны СМИ сохраняется. Уверена, появление личного видеоблога Юрия Александровича Берга, который он открыл 21 декабря, а также реализация перспективных проектов, заявленных в программе губернатора, позволит увеличить качественные показатели упоминаемости в региональных СМИ", - отметила Шевченко.

description.hltext_display: AK Parti İl Başkanı Karal, Risiad'ı Ziyaret Etti
description.content: AK Parti Rize İl Başkanı Hasan Karal, Rize Sanayici ve İşadamları Derneği'ni (RİSİAD) ziyaret etti. Beraberindeki il yönetim kurulu üyeleriyle RİSİAD Başkanı Mustafa Külünkoğlu ve yönetim kurulu üyeleri ile sohbet eden Karal, kentte kamuoyunu etkileme gücüne sahip sivil toplum kuruluşlarını ziyaret ettiklerini söyledi. Amaçlarının sivil toplum kuruluşlarının görüş ve düşüncelerini almak olduğunu ifade eden Karal, 'Yapılan çalışmalar hakkında her kesimin yapıcı eleştirileri ve katkı sağlayacak fikirlerini dinleyeceğiz. Rize'nin geleceği ile ilgili bizim düşünemediğimiz, sivil toplum örgütlerinin uygulanmasını uygun gördükleri konuları ortak akılla yapmamız lazım. Bu anlamda sivil toplum örgütlerini sık sık ziyaret ederek düşüncelerine başvurmayı hedefliyoruz' dedi. Devletin Rize'ye getirmesi gereken alt yapı çalışmaları konusunda çok ciddi mesafe aldıklarını ifade eden Karal, şunları kaydetti: 'Gerek eğitim, gerek sağlık, gerekse ulaşım alanında çok ciddi çalışmalar yapıldı, yapılmaya devam ediyor. Elbette eksiklerimiz var. Yapılması gereken çok daha iş var. Ama iktidarımız döneminde bu temel hizmetler anlamında çok ciddi yol kat etmiş durumdayız. Bu anlamda sivil toplum örgütlerinin gerek düşünce, gerekse plan ve proje olarak desteğiyle ilimizi çok daha modern, yaşanabilir bir haline getirmeyi amaçlıyoruz. Bu siyasi irade olarak sadece bizim işimiz değil. Bu, kentte yaşayan toplumun önde gelen kanaat önderleri ve sivil toplum örgütlerinin ortak akıl etrafında bütünleşip doğruları benimsemeyle olur. Rize'yi birlikte kalkındıracağız.' RİSİAD Rize Şube Başkanı Mustafa Külünkoğlu ise, Rize-Mardin otoyolunun önemli bir proje olduğunu belirterek, 'Rize'nin önünü açmak lazım. Rize'nin tek çıkış yolu üniversite ile Güneydoğuyu Anadolu Bölgesi ile bölgemiz arasında ilişkiyi artırmaktır. Üniversite hızla gelişiyor. Diş hekimliği fakültesinin yanında mühendislik fakültesinin de bir an önce açılması ile öğrenci sayısı daha da artacaktır' diye konuştu. Külünkoğlu, Karal'ın derneğimizi ziyaret ederek yatırım ve projelerle ilgili görüşlerini almasından memnuniyet duyduklarını kaydetti. (HS-ZAF-ÜNS) - RİZE (Anadolu Ajansı) 16 dakika önce.. [2430060]

description.hltext_display: 什么叫b股股票蓝筹品种|问题热度：☆☆|什么叫蓝筹股?什么叫A股?什么叫B股?麻烦帮我介绍一下股票的基本知识好吗/
description.content:
一下股票的基本知识好吗/2010-12-09公益广告提醒您:小草有生命,足下多留"青"。希望您能找到您的问题和答案,如果没有,请回复留言吧。再这里俺就不罗嗦了,下面是问题和答案。问题:什么叫蓝筹股?什么叫a股?什么叫b股?麻烦帮我介绍一下股票的基本知识好吗/本人认为最佳的答案:在海外股票市场上,都有蓝筹股的说法.所谓蓝筹股,是指业绩优良,市值较大,股性活跌的股份。在香港,读者耳目能详的蓝筹股有汇丰控股、长江实业、恒基发展、新鸿基地产、中信泰富等。现纳入恒生三十三指数的股份,由于都属于各行业的佼佼者,因此大都可算作蓝筹股,但是有股份开始走下坡路,如果变化较大,恒生指数服务公司会作适当的调整,即剔除某些股份,换进相同数量的新近发展较快的股份。蓝筹股这一说法近年来也逐渐为中国大陆的证券传媒所援用。深圳的深发展,上海的四川长虹、陆家嘴等都是证券界人士和证券传媒所喜闻乐道的蓝筹股。如果说蓝筹股的说法适应于几乎所有的股票市场的话,那么,红筹股的说法则仅适应于香港股票市场。目前对于红筹股的定义,尚存在一定的争议。主要观点有两种:一是按业务范围区分,即如果某上市公司的主要业务在中国大陆,其盈利中的大部分也来自该等业务,那么,该公司的上市股份即将称为红筹股,彭博资讯红筹股指数即按此标准遴选;二是按权益多寡区分,即,如果某上市公司权益中的大部分直接来自中国大陆,或具有大陆背景,那么,该公司的上市股份即是红筹股。今年4月中旬,恒生指数股公司着手编制恒生红筹股指数,该公司倾向于按权益多寡区分。在上述争议尚无定论之时,我们不妨将两方面的股份都看成红筹股。在香港最为有名的红筹股有:中信泰富、粤海投资、招商局海虹、上海实业,以及不久前上市的深业控股和北京控股等我国上市公司的股票有a股、b股、h股、n股、s股等的区分。这一区分的主要依据股票的上市地点和所面对的投资者而定。a股的正式名称是人民币普通股票。它是由我国境内的公司发行,供境内机构、组织、或个人(不含台、港、澳投资者)以人民币认购和交易的普通股票。1990年我国a股股票一共只有10只,至1997年底,a股股票增加到720只,a股总股本为1646亿股,总市值17529亿元人民币,与gdp的比率为22.7%。1997年a股年成交额为30295亿元人民币。我国a股股票市场经过几年快速发展,已经初具规模。b股的正式名称是人民币特种股票。它是以人民币标明面值,以外币认购和买卖,在境内(上海、深圳)证券交易所上市交易的。它的投资人限于:外国的自然人、法人和其他组织,香港、澳门、*河蟹*地区的自然人、法人和其他组织,定居在国外的中国公民,中国证监会规定的其他投资人。现阶段b股的投资人,主要是上述几类中的机构投资者。b股公司的注册地和上市地都在境内,只不过投资者在境外或在中国香港、澳门及*河蟹*。自1991底第一只b股---上海电真空b股上市发行以来,经过6年的发展,中国的b股市场已经由地方性市场发展到由中国证监会统一管理的全国性市场。到1997年底,我国b股股票有101只,总股本为125亿股,总市值为375亿元人民币,b股市场规模与a股市场相比要小的多。近几年来,我国还在b股衍生产品及其他方面做了一些有益的探索。例如,1995年在深圳南玻公司成功地发行了b股可转换债券,蛇口招商港务在新加坡进行了第二上市试点,沪、深两地的4家公司还进行了将b股转为一级adr在美国柜台市场交易的试点等。h股,即注册地在内地、上市地在香港的外资股。香港的英文是hong kong,取其字首,在香港上市外资股就叫做h股。依次类推,纽约的第一个英文字母是n,新加坡的第一个英文字母是s,纽约和新加坡上市的股票分别叫做n股和s股。股票是股份有限公司在筹集资本时向出资人发行的股份凭证。股票代表着其持有者(即股东)对股份公司的所有权。这种所有权是一种综合权利,如参加股东大会、投票表决、参与公司的重大决策。收取股息或分享红利等。同一类别的每一份股票所代表的公司所有权是相等的。每个股东所拥有的公司所有权份额的大小,取决于其持有的股票数量占公司总股本的比重。股票一般可以通过买卖方式有偿转让,股东能通过股票转让收回其投资,但不能要求公司返还其出资。股东与公司之间的关系不是债权债务关系。股东是公司的所有者,以其出资额为限对公司负有限只任,承担风险,分享收益。股票是社会化大生产的产物,已有近400年的历史。作为人类文明的成果,股份制和股票也适用于我国社会主义市场经济。企业可以通过向社会公开发行股票筹集资金用于生产经营。国家可通过控制多数股权的方式,用同样的资金控制更多的资源。目前在上海。深圳证券交易所上市的公司,绝大部分是国家控股公司。股票具有以下基本特征:(l)不可偿还性。股票是一种无偿还期限的有价证券,投资者认购了股票后,就不能再要求退股,只能到二级市场卖给第三者。股票的转让只意味着公司股东的改变,并不减少公司资本。从期限上看,只要公司存在,它所发行的股票就存在,股票的期限等于公司存续的期限。(2)参与性。股东有权出席股东大会,选举公司董事会,参与公司重大决策。股票持有者的投资意志和享有的经济利益,通常是通过行使股东参与权来实现的。股东参与公司决策的权利大小,取决于其所持有的股份的多少.从实践中看,只要股东持有的股票数量达到左右决策结果所需的实际多数时,就能掌握公司的决策控制权。(3)收益性。股东凭其持有的股票,有权从公司领取股息或红利,获取投资的收益。股息或红利的大小,主要取决于公司的盈利水平和公司的盈利分配政策。股票的收益性,还表现在股票投资者可以获得价差收人或实现资产保值增值。通过低价买人和高价卖出股票,投资者可以赚取价差利润。以美国可口可乐公司股票为例。如果在1983年底投资1000美元买人该公司股票,到1994年7月便能以11 554美元的市场价格卖出,赚取10倍多的利润。在通货膨胀时,股票价格会随着公司原有资产重置价格上升而上涨,从而避免了资产贬值。股票通常被视为在高通货膨胀期间可优先选择的投资对象。(4)流通性。股票的流通性是指股票在不同投资者之间的可交易性。流通性通常以可流通的股票数量、股票成交量以及股价对交易量的敏感程度来衡量。可流通股数越多,成交量越大,价格对成交量越不敏感(价格不会随着成交量一同变化),股票的流通性就越好,反之就越差。股票的流通,使投资者可以在市场上卖出所持有的股票,取得现金。通过股票的流通和股价的变动,可以看出人们对于相关行业和上市公司的发展前景和盈利潜力的判断。那些在流通市场上吸引大量投资者、股价不断上涨的行业和公司,可以通过增发股票,不断吸收大量资本进人生产经营活动,收到了优化资源配置的效果。(5)价格波动性和风险性。股票在交易市场上作为交易对象,同商品一样,有自己的市场行情和市场价格。由于股票价格要受到诸如公司经营状况、供求关系、银行利率、大众心理等多种因素的影响,其波动有很大的不确定性。正是这种不确定性,有可能使股票投资者遭受损失。价格波动的不确定性越大,投资风险也越大。因此,股票是一种高风险的金融产品。例如,称雄于世界计算机产业的国际商用机器公司(ibm),当其业绩不凡时,每股价格曾高达170美元,但在其地位遭到挑战,出现经营失策而招致亏损时,股价又下跌到40美元。如果不合时机地在高价位买进该股,就会导致严重损失基金有广义和狭义之分,从广义上说,基金是机构投资者的统称,包括信托投资基金、单位信托基金、公积金、保险基金、退休基金,各种基金会的基金。在现有的证券市场上的基金,包括封闭式基金和开放式基金,具有收益性功能和增值浅能的特点。从

description.hltext_display: La Asamblea de Caja de Burgos tumba la entrada de Cajasol en Banca Cívica
description.content:
Arribas se ve forzado a suspender la reunión hasta el jueves a la espera de poder sumar los apoyos necesarios
Hacía falta que diesen su apoyo a la propuesta 81 de los 101 consejeros que asistieron a la Asamblea; 20 votaron no, 8 lo hicieron en blanco y 73 a favor
Mie, 22/12/2010
R. G. U. / Burgos
La Asamblea de Caja de Burgos, suspendida por las «dudas» de su presidente ayer y vuelta a convocar para el jueves, no ha servido, como estaba previsto, para aprobar el nuevo contrato de integración derivado de la incorporación de Cajasol en Banca Cívica. Sólo ha servido para ganar tiempo.
Tiempo para que los representantes de los trabajadores se reúnan hoy de nuevo con los negociadores nombrados por las cajas para seguir negociando las condiciones laborales de la nueva Banca Cívica. Obviamente en una posición mucho más fuerte que ayer.
Y tiempo para que José María Arribas pueda maniobrar para sumar los pocos apoyos que matemáticamente necesita para que salga adelante la propuesta. Aunque, por otra parte, podría obtener igualmente el visto bueno directamente del Banco de España aunque quede pendiente la aprobación final de la Asamblea de Caja de Burgos.
Al menos esa es la opción que barajan fuentes de Cajasol consultadas por este periódico.
En cualquier caso, el presidente de Caja de Burgos, José María Arribas ha tenido habilidad y cintura para ‘salvar’ el resultado de la Asamblea forzando la suspensión hasta el jueves. Para entonces puede haberse llegado a un acuerdo en la negociación laboral encallada en el firme rechazo de los empleados a transigir con la movilidad geográfica obligatoria que Banca Cívica ha incorporado a sus condiciones laborales tras la llegada de Cajasol; además de ciertas cuestiones salariales más fácilmente superables.
Paralelamente, la suspensión de la Asamblea otorga al presidente de la Caja un plazo para asegurarse que tendrá suficientes votos afirmativos la próxima vez que someta a votación en la Asamblea los términos de la integración a Banca Cívica.
Las matemáticas favorecen a Arribas. De los 120 consejeros de Caja de Burgos acudieron ayer a la Asamblea 101, con lo que la mayoría de 4/5 necesaria para validar la propuesta le obligaba a contar con 81 votos a favor. Tuvo 73. Ocho consejeros votaron en blanco y 20 dijeron no.
La votación fue nominal y secreta, por primera vez en la historia moderna de Caja de Burgos, a petición de los empleados que, presumiblemente, contabilizaron sólo sus propios votos: 20 de un total de 21 asientos que les corresponden en la Asamblea entre los que se eligen directamente entre los empleados más las candidaturas de CCOO y UGT elegidas por los impostores.
De los 19 consejeros ausentes ayer, por tanto, puede depender el resultado final de la votación del jueves. Podrán sumarse sin problema a la Asamblea porque, como explicó ayer Arribas, «normalmente no cerramos la puerta». Esas fueron sus únicas declaraciones tras confirmar que había suspendido la Asamblea porque tenía «dudas» y posponer cualquier otra explicación para la comparecencia tras la sesión del jueves.

description.hltext_display: •我媽嫌男友家里窮長得丑 跟他要10萬
description.content:
http://www.tianshannet.com 天山網 2010年12月22日 11:40:47 我來說兩句
更換背景顏色︰
更改文字大小︰
問︰
我的戀愛戀遭到父母的反對，說是因為他長得不好看，家又太遠。心里太難受了，也不知道怎麼辦。男友一直都對我很好，人也很有上進心。 昨天接到媽媽打來的電話，她說不同意我們兩人在一起，又提到他長得不好看。面對這樣的理由，我該怎麼辦呢？
我媽說如果要是非在一起，那就讓我朋友給她送過去10萬塊錢。以後的事情，她也就不再摻和了。這叫什麼呀？
答︰
無論這叫什麼，都是不重要的。你可以了解一下你媽說這種話的誠意。如果他明知你男友做不到也故意出難題，等你男朋友真給她送去10萬塊錢，她又要提出別的來難為他，那基本上這話就沒什麼意義。但如果她其實有一點妥協的空間，需要一個理由來說服自己接受你們的關系，那你真的可以跟你男朋友商量能否解決。
如果他問你這叫什麼呀，你就用我剛才說的話來回答他︰無論這叫什麼，都是不重要的……

description.hltext_display: Sibal meets trio telecom giants, Mittal, Tata, Reliance on spectrum issue
description.author: admin
description.content:
Share
The minister also wanted inputs for drafting a comprehensive new telecom policy
Communications Minister Kapil Sibal Tuesday met the chairmen of India's top three telecom companies to get their views on matters that are coming in the way of the industry's growth, including the process to award airwaves now under a cloud.
The minister met with Airtel chairman Sunil Bharti Mittal, Tata Telecom chairman Ratan Tata and Reliance Communications chairman Anil Ambani, and is scheduled to hold similar meetings with the top brass of other companies Wednesday, officials said.
The three industrialists, however, declined to talk to the media after their meetings.
The agenda for the close-door meetings included dicussion on hoarding of airwaves by some telecom companies, move to cancel licenses of some firms for poor roll-out of services, and fine-tuning of existing policy on spectrum for the future, officials said.
"The minister also wanted inputs for drafting a comprehensive new telecom policy," said an official, adding that the general perception is that the previous one, in existence since 1999, has been the root cause of the current mess.
The meetings started as the communications ministry began issuing notices to those firms that had failed to comply with the roll-out norms for second generation telecom services as also those that had not disclosed their proper corporate structure.
Communications Minister Kapil Sibal had said there were 119 cases where these roll-out obligations were not met and 85 cases where firms had manipulated the self-certification process about their financial strength and main line of business to get the licences.
Last week, India's telecom watchdog had recommended scrapping of 69 of the 130 licences given for 2G phone services since December 2006. Of these, 20 had been issued to Loop, 15 to Etisalat DB, 11 to Sistema-Shyam, 10 to Videocon, 8 to Uninor, and 5 to Aircel.
The licences stipulate coverage of at least 90 percent of the areas in metro centres within one year. In non-metro areas, 10 percent of the towns must be covered in the first year and 50 percent within three years.
Last month, DMK leader A. Raja was forced to resign as communications minister after the official audit institution indicted him in the spectrum scam and said he caused notional losses of Rs.58,000 crore ($12.8 billion) to Rs.1.76 lakh crore ($40 billion) to the exchequer.
Raja -- also being probed by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) -- is alleged to have sold spectrum at below market rates. Sibal, too, named a one-man panel to examine how appropriate the current norms are to allocate airwaves to telecom players.

event_or_fact.property: comprehensive new telecom policy Communications Minister

there were 119 cases where these roll-out obligations were not met and 85 cases where firms had manipulated the self-certification process about their financial strength and main line of business to get the licences

description.hltext_display: Jordan has too many holes to fill
description.author: Dave Werstine, Staff
description.content:
BELLFLOWER - The task in front of the Jordan High boys basketball team on Tuesday night was tough, playing against St. John Bosco and standout C.J. Guerrero. Missing a pair of key players made it all the more difficult.
The Panthers gave a spirited effort but couldn't keep up with the Braves in a 67-55 loss at St. John Bosco.
Jordan (4-5) was without the services of Isaah Hicks and TJ Clement and the offense didn't quite go the way first-year coach Joel Rosborough hoped it would.
"It affected us a lot. They are our top two scorers," Rosborough said of missing Hicks and Clement. "I expected us to come together and play hard, but we didn't make enough buckets and struggled offensively."
While the offense struggled, the defensive game plan went pretty well, as the Panthers held the highly recruited Guerrero to 14 points - just three field goals (one in the first half) .
"The plan was to make someone else beat us," Rosborough said. "We did a good job on him."
However, Braiten Madrigal (14 points), Erick Martinez (15 points) and Darryl Matthews (10 points) were there to pick up the scoring slack for the Braves (10-1).
It was Martinez who got the Braves off to a good start, scoring 12 of his points in the first quarter to lead the Braves to a 19-9 advantage.
Guerrero, who had just two points in the first quarter, hit five of six free throws in the second quarter to help SJB maintain a somewhat comfortableyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); lead.
After Jordan knocked down a pair of quick shots to get within 33-28 in the third quarter, Guerrero responded with a three-point play to boost the Braves' lead to 36-28, and then a 3-pointer, a three-point play and a fastbreak layup by Madrigal put SJB ahead 49-34 with 1:56 left in the period.
Damien Christian kept Jordan in the game in the second quarter and helped it from being a blowout in the fourth. He scored eight points in the second and six in the fourth en route to a game-high 19 points.

event_or_fact.property: The plan was to make someone else beat us; We did a good job on him.
It affected us a lot.; They are our top two scorers; I expected us to come together and play hard, but we didn't make enough buckets and struggled offensively.

description.hltext_display: Aranda estudia si llevar ante los tribunales el incremento de las tasas en el Consorcio
description.content:
La asamblea del Consorcio desestima los cuatro recursos presentados contra el alza de tasas
Mie, 22/12/2010
LORETO VELÁZQUEZ / Aranda
Cinco días después de que la Secretaría del Consorcio de Residuos propusiera desestimar los cuatro recursos presentados contra la subida de la tasa por el alcalde de Sotillo, el Arzobispado de Burgos, el alcalde de Caleruega y el Ayuntamiento de Aranda, la Asamblea ha decidido seguir adelante con la subida de la tarifa y no tener en cuenta las reclamaciones. «Como era de esperar, han votado todos a piñón», explica el concejal de Medio Ambiente del Ayuntamiento de Aranda, Ildefonso Sanz quien lamenta que no haya prosperado una de sus principales demandas para que Burgos, que tiene el 42 por ciento de los votos, pague como todos. «La mayoría ha votado que Burgos no tiene por qué pagar. Ahora que cada uno se responsabilice de su voto y se lo explique a sus ciudadanos», afirma mientras apunta a ayuntamientos que han apoyado el incremento del pago como Hoyales o Torresandino.
Modificaciones
Aunque la asamblea ha rechazado la mayoría de sus planteamientos, acepta sin embargo algunas modificaciones como concretar el valor catastral de construcción y retirar el pago de la plaza de aparcamiento anexa que pretendían cobrar para los propietarios que adquieran la plaza después de comprar la vivienda.
Consciente de que el grueso del recurso no ha sido aceptado, el Ayuntamiento de Aranda estudiará con el departamento jurídico si acudir a la vía de lo Contencioso Administrativo. «En cuanto sepamos algo lo anunciaremos», subraya Ildefonso Sanz quien a finales de octubre denunciaba ante los medios una subida que calificó como exagerada y salvaje y de la que responsabiliza directamente a la Diputación de Burgos y al Ayuntamiento de Burgos. «Es un impuesto, impuesto desde Burgos que nada tiene que ver ni con el grupo socialista ni con el Ayuntamiento de Aranda. Lo único que nos generan son problemas», sentenciaba entonces.
Parámetros
Aprobada ya la subida que en los casos más graves, según el PSOE, ronda el 58 por ciento, la ordenanza incorpora unos nuevos parámetros en función del valor catastral. Así, las viviendas que tengan un valor catastral de entre 5.000 y 30.000 euros pagarán 34,5 euros mientras que las que se encuentren en la franja de 30.000 a 50.000 euros incrementarán el pago hasta los 39 euros. Por su parte, las viviendas con valores catastrales entre los 50.000 y 70.000 pagarán 46 euros y las superiores a 70.000 deberán abonar 50 euros.
Aranda
En industriales, la medida afecta principalmente a Aranda y Miranda con subidas que van en el tramo 1, de los 129 a los 206 euros; en el tramo 2, de los 147 a los 233; en el tramo 3, de los 173 a los 275 y en el tramo 4, de los 207 a los 330 euros. En ocio y hostelería, la subida va de los 94,5 a 150 euros. En comercios y tiendas, pasan de 63 euros a 90 en el tramo 2 y a 100 euros, en el tramo 3. Por último, las oficinas suben de 47,27 a 50 euros en el tramo 1 y a 75 euros en el tramo 2.

description.hltext_display: Poly knocks off No. 1 Mater Dei
description.content:
Poly's girls basketball team took down the top-ranked team in the country.
Behind 26 points from USC-bound guard Ariya Crook-Williams, the Jackrabbits knocked off Mater Dei at the Nike Tournament of Champions in Arizona on Tuesday, 61-56. The Monarchs came into the game unbeaten - they are now 8-1 - and as the top-ranked team by USA Today.
Poly (6-1) rallied in the third quarter and outscored Mater Dei, 18-7. Monarch senior Kaleena Mosqueda-Lewis had a game-high 33 points but only scored two in the third.
Crook-Williams scored 20 points in the second half.
The Jackrabbits, ranked No. 5 by USA Today, play No. 3 Brea Olinda for the tournament championship tonight at 7.
Warren 50, JSerra 33: Junior point guard Danielle Rodriguez scored 19 points for the host Bears (8-1) in a nonleague victory.
Mayfair 60, Pioneer 37: Senior guard Diamond Roberts had 20 points, 16 rebounds, five assists and five steals for the Monsoons (4-7) at the Cantwell-Sacred Heart Tournament. Boys basketball Terrence Fulton scored 21 points and grabbed 14 rebounds for Cerritos (4-7) in a 56-37 victory over host Cypress in nonleague play. Fulton was 3-for-5 on 3-point shots and Aaron Wright added 12 points, four rebounds and three assists. Wrestling

description.hltext_display: Plácido Domingo feiert 3500. Opern-Vorstellung
description.content:
Wien (AZ) - Ein Blumenregen, eine riesige Torte und Glückwünsche an den «Weltmeister der Oper»: Startenor Plácido Domingo hat am Dienstagabend in Wien seine 3500. Opern-Vorstellung gefeiert.
«Ich bin glücklich, stolz und dankbar, dass ich dieses Ereignis hier feiern kann», sagte der Künstler bei einem Fest im Anschluss an die letzte Vorstellung der Oper «Il Postino» im Theater an der Wien. Der 69-Jährige, der im Frühjahr eine Krebsoperation überstanden hat, kündigte an: «Ich werde wiederkommen und alle meine Pläne verwirklichen».
Zahlreiche Künstlerkollegen, Fans und Freunde feierten mit dem spanischen Musiker. «Nach meiner 700. Vorstellung, das war 'La Traviata' in New York, habe ich beschlossen, immer nach 100 Aufführungen eine Party zu feiern», erzählte Domingo. «Mittlerweile habe ich überall auf der Welt gefeiert». Mitarbeiter des Theaters an der Wien überreichten dem Sänger eine große Torte, auf der ein stilisierter Bühnenvorhang zu sehen war. In schwarzen Buchstaben stand darauf: «3500 Vorstellungen - Der Weltmeister der Oper».

description.hltext_display: 58th National Snooker Championship - Susantha does it for 14th time
description.content:
Susantha Botheju beat Rayan Somaratne 7-1 in the grand final of the 58th National Snooker Championship to clinch the national title for the 14th occasion on Sunday (Dec. 19) at the Billiards and Snooker Association headquarters in Colombo. Susantha had an easy sail against his opponent in the final and the scores were 55-29, 66-1, 73-31, 72-4, 65-39, 61-29, 19-60 and 47-39. Zaheer Gaffar became the second runner-up in the championship while Bharata Siriwardena finished fourth.
According G. V. S. Jayalal, a member of the Billiards and Snooker Association, with this feat Susantha enters into the record books of snooker as the cueist with the second highest number of titles. Legendary M. J. M. Lafir has won the same title on 18 occasions to top the list. (MP)

description.hltext_display: Moving Forward
description.author: David Felton, Staff Writer
description.content:
It was, quite simply, one of the biggest upsets in the history of the CIF State girls basketball tournament.
At the end of last season, Poly High was one victory shy of an unprecedented fifth consecutive Division I title. The Jackrabbits had won 23 games in a row, were ranked as high as No. 5 in the country and were huge favorites against Oak Ridge of El Dorado Hills.
There was just one problem. Oak Ridge won the game, 55-42, denying the Jackrabbits a place in California prep basketball history and stunning almost everyone who follows girls hoops nationally.
But, according to Poly coach Carl Buggs, the Jackrabbits have put that loss aside and are out to begin a new streak of state championships.
"We've moved on," Buggs said. "We don't really dwell on the past."
Nine returning players, including three who have signed national letters of intent, are determined to get past that loss and re-establish Poly's dominance in Division I.
But the Jackrabbits will have to overcome fellow Southland powers Mater Dei and Brea Olinda, who have moved from Division II to Division I at the state level, and are both in the CIF Southern Section Division I-AA this season. Poly is ranked No. 5 nationally by USA Today and are No. 3 in Division I-AA, right behind Mater Dei and Brea Olinda.
Here's a closer look at the area's teams: Moore League As usual, Poly is loaded with talent. Senior post Sheila Boykin, lastyld_mgr.place_ad_here("adPosBox"); season's Dream Team Player of the Year, has signed with UCLA while senior point guard Ariya Crook-Williams put pen to paper with USC. And the Jackrabbits, who have been known to bring wave after wave of reserves off the bench in the past, are even deeper this time around.
"We've got 12 kids that can contribute on a regular basis," Buggs said. "And this could be the best perimeter-shooting team we've had in my 12 years."
Senior post Taijhe Kelly (6-foot-3) and junior forward Kameron Jones (6-2) give Poly excellent size inside and junior Destiny King plays bigger than the 5-9 listed on Poly's roster.
Off the bench will come senior Alexis Dalton, junior Olivia Montgomery and talented freshmen Arica Carter and Justyce Dawson. Buggs calls junior Breyon Alexander "one of our best defenders" and sophomore Keyla Morgan is a transfer from Inglewood. Senior guard Ashley Johnson has signed with Division II Texas-Commerce.
Just like in the past few years, Poly's goals are lofty this season. The Jackrabbits want to win the CIF-SS Division I-AA title, the CIF State Division I title and the USA Today national crown.
Jordan and coach Adara Newidouski have lofty goals as well. The Panthers finished second to Poly in the Moore League a year ago and advanced to the Division I-AA quarterfinals.
"We want to challenge for the Moore League (title)," Newidouski said. "I'd really like to think we can challenge (Poly) this year. ... The kids want to live up to (what they did last season). They want to get back there and do better.
"They know what it takes," continued Newidouski, who returns nine players from last year's team. "It's just a matter of maintaining that hunger."
Senior shooting guard Armani Wiley will pace the Jordan attack. Senior forwards Amber Washington and Kaaron King are 3-point threats and fellow senior Kyasha Wilson can score from the inside or outside.
"That really allows us to do lots St. Anthony's team from left: Suekalena Tafao, Jourdan Cooper, Kendall Cooper, Lauren Siaumau, Raquel Johnson, and Natalie Williams. (Jeff Gritchen/Staff Photographer)of things, like spread the floor," Newidouski said.
First-year coach Reta Sula inherited some young and talented players at Wilson, including sophomore guards Janelle Porter and Michaela Reed and junior post players Kamika Mason and Joi Bertrand (6-2). Mason has averaged 12.5 points and 8.0 rebounds so far this season to lead the team in both categories.
"She's a good rebounder and an awesome scorer," Sula said.
Senior guard Samira Fields averages 6.1 points and 2.6 rebounds.
"She's our senior, our leader," Sula said.
Reed is the kind of player who can contribute without scoring a lot of points. She's averaging 8.0 points this season but also has 3.4 rebounds and 2.6 steals.
"She's got great hustle on defense," said Sula.
Cabrillo's roster shows just one senior, one junior, four sophomores and two freshmen for first-year coach Yukie Hawkins.
"We're young and inexperienced," Hawkins said, "but we're getting better weekly. The players are committed to changing the (losing) stigma of Cabrillo girls basketball. They're hanging in there."
Senior Destiny Sutton is a versatile player who can contribute from the inside or outside.
"She's a post but she can play point guard, handle the ball, lead the team and also score some points," Hawkins said.
Junior Dominique Wright is a talented 3-point shooter who has improved her defensive play of late. "Her confidence is coming up," Hawkins said.
Millikan has a good mix of experience and youth with six seniors, four sophomores and three freshmen.
Junior forward Basha Brulee-Wills leads the Rams so far this season with 14.0 points, 14.0 rebounds and 2.0 steals per game. Senior guard Nicole Mendez contributes on defense with 6.5 steals and senior forward Emily Hale averages 10.0 rebounds and 2.5 steals. "They'll be scrappy," said Buggs, "and they'll be fighting for a playoff spot."
New Lakewood coach Randy Fletcher will rely on senior point guard Jasmine Balangue, who is the top returner in terms of scoring (11.1) and assists (2.7).
Guard Nicolette Rodriguez is a returning senior and center Allison Young returns for her sophomore season.
Compton is off to a 5-6 start to the season, thanks in part to senior post/forward Malaysia Locklin (8.6 points, 6.9 rebounds).
In the post, senior Zcharity Johnson and Ke'Aira Bowie are both strong rebounders and senior guard Sparkle Robinson will run the show from the perimeter. San Gabriel Valley League Nary a senior can be found on the roster of Lynwood, the SGVL's standard bearer over the last decade. This year's squad, ranked No.9 in Division I-AA, will attempt to defend its league title with six juniors, three sophomores and a pair of freshmen.
Junior guards T'Keya Mason and Shahanna Zeigler each averaged 8.0 points last season for Lynwood, which was ousted in the second round of the playoffs.
In the post, sophomore Amber Blockmon and juniors Tanya Simpson and Jolana Ford stand 6-2, 6-1 and 6-0, respectively.
At Warren, third-year coach Rachel Palmer has a squad many feel can challenge Lynwood for the league crown. The Bears, ranked No. 8 in the first CIF-Division I-AA poll of the season, are an experienced bunch led by senior post Franny Vaaulu and junior point guard Danielle Rodriguez.
"We're gonna try," said Palmer when asked if this was the year her team would knock off Lynwood. "I think we have the potential to do great things."
Vaaulu, who stands 6-3, averaged nearly 14 rebounds per game a year ago and consistently dominated the paint for Warren. She has already signed a letter of intent to play at Utah State. Palmer said Vaaulu is showing more maturity this season and is determined to end her prep career on a positive note.
Rodriguez led the team in scoring (14.1) and assists (7.4) during a breakout sophomore campaign. She's grown two inches to 5-11 and has the ability to take games over with drives to the basket and strong defensive rebounding. She's already receiving significant recruiting interest, "from the big and the small," according to Palmer.
Sophomore Justene Reyes and junior Samantha Madrid are both listed at 6-0 and give Palmer good depth inside. Senior guard Tania Ayala stands just 5-4 but is tough as nails and junior wing Tahja Matthews is the Bears' most consistent 3-point threat.
"The girls are a little more dedicated (than last year), a little more focused," Palmer said. "They have a good vision of what they want to do and are working hard for it."
Junior point guard Rayana Villalpando leads Downey into the season for first-year coach Ray Walker. Villalpando suffered a knee injury last year and sat out her sophomore year.
"She's the key to what we do," Walker said.
Senior guard Irma Urzua is the Vikings' best defender, according to Walker and junior forward Amissa Segura will be Downey's third option on offense in addition to defending, rebounding and chasing down loose balls.
"She'll do all the dirty work," Walker said.
Senior forward Symone Brown and sophomore guard Jewelyn Sawyer are the known quantities for Gahr. Sophomore guard Jasmine Gates and junior point Zenata Agu are not. At least not yet.
"They key to our team is how quickly Gates and Agu pick up the system," Gladiator coach Al Dorogusker said. "But I think we'll be a good team."
Brown, at 5-10, earned All-CIF Division III-A and All-SGVL honors as a junior. She signed with Montana State during the early signing period.
"Basically, she does everything," Dorogusker said. "She's a scorer, no doubt about it."
Sawyer stands 5-11, runs the floor well and has a 76-inch wing span, which should translate into plenty of rebounds, blocks and steals. She can also score from inside or outside.
Gahr is ranked No. 13 in Division III-AA.
Senior guard Gavy Camarena and senior center Maijah Becerra return for a Dominguez team that features four seniors and five freshmen.
The Dons, who went 0-14 a season ago, have already earned four victories, including a 3-1 record at the Calvary Chapel Downey Tournament.
Paramount, under Coach Roesheka Polk, will attempt to improve upon last season's 10-16 overall record and a 2-8 mark in the SGVL.
The Pirates have played in the St. Anthony, Glenn-Norwalk and Cantwell-Sacred Heart tournaments. Suburban League Mayfair is the defending league champion and features a three-guard attack led by seniors Amanda Gosselin and Diamond Roberts and sophomore Nisja Bass. Gosselin has moved from shooting guard to the point this season and Coach Vince Nicholson calls her his "floor leader." Roberts is eligible after transferring from Poly two years ago and will contribute steals and rebounds when not scoring. Bass is the Monsoons' best 3-point threat but is also a terrific defender.
"She's not one-dimensional," Nicholson said. "She's an all-around player."
Junior forward Imani Joseph and junior post Jamesha West round out the starting lineup. Joseph is looking to score more in her second varsity season and will be matched up against the opposition's top scorer.
"She's one of the best athletes at Mayfair High, boy or girl," Nicholson said. "... She's so naturally gifted."
Nicholson calls West "the consummate role player" and is thrilled with the potential of freshman Jessica Torrez.
Seniors Arlene Gomez, Sharae Moten and Sarai Robles are all returning starters for coach Linda Parra and are all three-year varsity players.
"I don't know if anybody gets as much out of her players as (Parra)," Nicholson said.
Seniors Kira Orta (forward), Casey Tope (guard) and Melinda Tanuvasa (forward) are the only returning players for Bellflower, which finished third in 2009 after winning the league title in 2008.
"We're still trying to figure out what we are," Coach Chad Reuter said. "We're not too big, not too fast. We just have to play good defense ... and minimize our turnovers."
Junior guard Karay Franklin has joined the starting lineup in her first varsity season.
Reuter sees Mayfair as the team to beat and feels any one of four or five teams can secure an automatic playoff berth.
"(The rest of us) are still trying to figure out what we're gonna do," he said.
Norwalk, under veteran coach Richard Drake, begins the post-Alexis Love era with a a senior-laden lineup. Guard/forward Stacie Ramirez, guard Vanessa Ramirez and guard Giselle Sanchez are all returners for the Lancers, who reached the Division II-A playoffs last year as an at-large team.
Six-foot junior post Nia Lateju is averaging 8.3 points and 7.4 rebounds so far this season. She'll be called upon to replace Love, now playing at Loyola Marymount, in the paint.
Under second-year coach Nicole McCarthy, La Mirada is off to a 6-2 start after going 5-18 a year ago.
"They're the sleeper school in our league," Nicholson said.
Senior forward Makenna Wright is averaging 12.6 points and 10.0 rebounds so far and senior guard Stephanie Monroy averages 3.4 assists and 2.3 steals. They are the team's co-captains. Junior Kalena Glover grabs 8.6 rebounds a game.
Cerritos has had a say in the league's outcome over the last several years - league champ in 2008 and runner-up the last two years - but returns just one player, junior guard Katey Kanamoto. Eight players from last year's team, all of whom are seniors, chose not to play this season.
Lonnie Hinchen is Artesia's latest coach, and he has three returners on whom to rely.
Te Hsuan Chao and Elaine Young are seniors and Dana Arrington is a junior. Arrington led the Pioneers in scoring (5.5) and rebounds (7.3) a year ago. Others At St. Anthony, the Saints hope to build upon last season, when they won the CIF-SS Division V-A title and advanced all the way to the CIF State Division V championship game. To do so, however, they'll have to get past some early-season injuries and the transfer of a starter.
"We're trying to find our identity," Coach James Anderson said. "We're a work in progress. We're not bad, but at times we look bad."
Sophomore Kendall Cooper should be St. Anthony's go-to player. The 6-3 post improved her footwork over the summer and has excellent touch around the basket. While at Narbonne High, Anderson coached McDonald's All-Americans Morghan Medlock and Wilnette Crockett, and he said Cooper is further along at the same age. "She's really improving her defense and she's handling the ball more," said Anderson. "The sky's the limit (for her future)."
Kendall's older sister, Jourdan, is a senior wing and another important returner. She recently committed to play at UC Riverside. Senior post Natalie Williams stands 6-1 and is also a returner.
"She's consistent," Anderson said. "You know you're gonna get 10 (points) and 10 (rebounds) from her."
The backcourt is where the Saints are struggling early. Sophomore guard Jordan Jackson, a starter last season, transferred to Muir while junior Raquel Johnson is out with a broken finger. Sophomore Sydney Heard recently returned to the lineup after being held out for academic reasons.
The Saints are once again playing a tough nonleague schedule - the Nike TOC, the Diamond State Classic in Delaware and a home game against Serra on Jan. 4 - before opening play in the Santa Fe League, where Bell-Jeff is the gold standard.
"Until we beat (Bell-Jeff), they're the champs," Anderson said. "There is no rivalry until you beat a team. We need to beat them."
St. Anthony is ranked No. 2 in the first Division IV-A poll of the season.
Valley Christian was one of three area teams to reach a CIF-SS divisional final last season, but the only one to lose. Third-year head coach Katie Hardeman thinks her experienced team can do even more this season.
"Our goal is definitely to get back (to the CIF finals)," said Hardeman, whose team was moved up from Division V-AA to IV-A. "It's definitely possible."
The Crusaders are led by junior phenom Kari Korver, a 5-9 guard who's in 3-point range as soon as she steps in the gym. Korver is also a talented rebounder and defender and makes sure her teammates are in the right positions on offense and defense.
"We ask her to do a lot," Hardeman said, "rebound, score, bring the ball up. But she's the type of player who can handle it."
Korver already has a scholarship offer from Pepperdine and has also drawn interest from Oregon and Oregon State.
Guards Jamie Perez and Jelissa Holder are both experienced seniors and 5-9 junior post Nia Archer has shown a lot of improvement.The Crusaders are ranked sixth in Division IV-A.
At Los Alamitos, senior guards Lynne Higashigawa and Rachel Bass have the Griffins off to a 9-2 start and a No. 12 ranking in Division I-A.
Junior center Haley Gorman, who stands 6-1, is averaging 8.4 rebounds and 7.7 points early in the season.
At St. Joseph, seniors Imee Uy and Beth Lyons are returners for coach Joe Pacheco. Uy averaged 6.2 points as a junior while Lyon averaged 4.2 points and 3.2 rebounds.
The Jesters have played in the San Marino and Glenn/Norwalk tournaments so far and have a respectable 4-2 record. They open Camino Real League play at home against St. Monica on Jan. 11.
Marissa Rendon is the top scorer for St. Paul, which is ranked No. 3 in Division V-AA. The Swordsmen hope to improve upon a fourth-place finish in the Del Rey League this season.
CAMS will have a young team this season, but coach Tanya Watwood is very excited about the future. "We'll be a team to be reckoned with (in the Delphic League)," she said.
Freshman guards Nicole Kuriki and Desire Hayden drew high praise from Watwood, who starts three freshmen and two sophomores. Sophomore forward Alyssa Krug is the team captain and a leader on the court.
St. Matthias will battle St. Anthony in the Santa Cruz League. Sophomore Brianna Gutierrez is the leading returner in scoring (5.6) and rebounds (0.7) for the Victorians. Junior wing Jasmine Henriquez leads the team in scoring this season at 5.3 and junior wing Mayra Bravo is scoring 5.0.
Calvary Chapel Downey is led by senior guard Ashley Duyao, who is averaging 12.8 points and 7.1 rebounds for the Grizzlies.
Sophomore forward Anika Bousema averages 7.3 rebounds and has 18 blocked shots in 10 games.
Calvary Chapel opens Delphic League play Jan. 4 at home against Crossroads.
L.A. Adventist will rely upon senior wing Michelle Pfirrman (13.3 points) and senior guard Selina Breshears (6.7 assists) in the Mulholland League, where the Eagles are the defending champs.
Avalon returns senior wing Diana Campos (10.0 points) and juniors Tori Hoefs (6.3 steals, 2.5 assists) and Ashlyn Mehan (12.8 rebounds) for competition in the San Joaquin League.
Centennial has struggled to a 2-4 start to the season, but has played some tough competition, including defending CIF State Division I champion Oak Ridge at the Brea-Olinda Ladycat Classic.

description.hltext_display: Major Reshuffle in Police Deptt.
description.content:
Jammu, Dec 21,KONS – The State Cabinet, which met here Tuesday evening under the Chairmanship of Chief Minister, Omar Abdullah, ordered major reshuffle in police department. Ram Lubhaya Addl. DG Police, awaiting orders of adjustment has been posted as ADGP, Home Guards/Civil Defence & Aux Police while S.Gopal Reddy, IPS, Addl. DG Police awaiting orders of adjustment has been posted as Addl. DG Police, Civil Military Liaison and Internal Security in the Home Department.
3.Dilbagh Singh, IPS, (JK:87), Director, SKPA, Udhampur has been transferred and posted as IGP, Jammu Zone vice A.K.Gupta, IPS.
4 A.K.Gupta, IPS (JK:87) IGP, Jammu Zone has been transferred and posted as Director, SKPA, Udhampur vice Dilbagh Singh.
5.Deepak Kumar, IPS (JK:93) presently on training has been posted as IGP, Vigilance.
6.Gulzar Singh Slathia,IPS (JK:93), DIG, Udhampur-Reasi Range has been transferred and posted as IG in the J&K State Human Rights Commission.
7.Abdul Qayoom Manhas, IPS (JK:94) DIG, Traffic, Kashmir has been transferred and posted as DIG, Trainings, Armed Police Headquarters.
8.S.D.Singh, IPS ( JK:95) DIG, Poonch-Rajouri Range has been transferred and posted as Joint Director, SKPA, Udhampur vice Sham Lal.
9. Rajesh Kumar, IPS (JK:95) Director, SSG, has been transferred and posted as DIG, Poonch-Rajouri Range vice S.D.Singh.
10. Sham Lal Sharma, IPS (JK:96) Joint Director, SKPA Udhampur has been transferred and posted as DIG, Home Gaurds/Civil Defence against an available vacancy.
11. Jagjit Kumar, IPS (JK:96) Director, Civil Military Liaison in the Home Department has been transferred and posted as DIG, Udhampur-Reasi Range vice Gulzar Singh.
12. Mubarik Ahmad Ganai, IPS (JK:96) DIG in the J&K State Human Rights Commission has been transferred and posted as DIG, Railways, J&K.
13. J.P. Singh, IPS (JK:96) DIG, IRP, Kashmir has been transferred and posted as Director, SSG vice Rajesh Kumar.
14. Garib Dass, IPS(JK:97) SSP, Kathua has been transferred and posted as DIG, CIV, Police Headquarter against the post of DIG, Personnel, PHQ.
15. Vijay Kumar, IPS (JK:97) SSP, Traffic National Highway has been transferred and posted as DIG Traffic Kashmir vice A.Q. Manhas.
16. K.L.Bhagat, IPS (JK:97) Commandant, JKAP 12th Bn. has been transferred and posted as DIG, IRP Kashmir, vice J. P. Singh.
17. N.D.Wani, IPS (JK:97) AIG (Personnel), PHQ has been transferred and posted as DIG, CID, Kashmir against an available vacancy.
18. S. Anand Jain, IPS(JK:99) SSP, Reasi has been transferred and posted as SSP, Rajouri vice Ramesh Jalla.
19. Manmohan Singh, IPS (JK: 99) SSP, Poonch has been transferred and posted as Commandant, JKAP 12th Bn vice K.L.Bhagat.
20. Ashkoor Ahmad Wani, IPS(JK:99) Commandant, IR 6th Bn has been transferred and posted as SSP Poonch vice Manmohan Singh.
21. Ali Mohammad, IPS (JK:99) AIG (Provision/Tpt), PHQ has been transferred and posted as SSP, CID, Hqrs. vice Israr Khan.
22. J.L. Sharma, IPS (JK:99) SSP, Samba has been transferred and posted as SSP, Kathua vice Garib Dass.
23. Bashir Ahmad Itoo, IPS (JK:99) Commandant, JKAP 14th Bn has been transferred and posted as SSP in the J&K State Human Rights Commission vice Gh. Hassan Shah.

description.hltext_display: Outdoor Christmas party Thursday in Phoenicia
description.content:
PHOENICIA — The center of this town of Shandaken hamlet will be transformed into something more like the North Pole this week thanks to a group of local business leaders.
An outdoor Christmas party is scheduled to begin at 4:30 p.m. Thursday on what has become the unofficial village square — the now wide-open space where the Phoenicia Hotel stood until burning to the ground three years ago.
The property, at the corner of Main and Church streets, in the middle of Phoenicia’s business district, was purchased and cleaned up by local entrepreneur Declan Feehan, who left a deck, a gazebo and a small cottage, which were the only structures spared by the flames.
Michael Koegel leased the property last summer and transformed those remaining structures into Mama’s Boy Café and Espresso Bar.
Koegel said the idea for Thursday’s festivities came about naturally when he and other organizers began brainstorming in the fall.
“We talked to a bunch of people — mostly merchants and some community-minded people, and we were looking for ways to promote Phoenicia,” he said. “One of the things quickly decided was that we wanted to do something for Christmas. Then we realized that Maria (Todaro) already had this caroling thing set up.”
Todaro is a co-founder of the Phoenicia Festival of the Voice, along with her husband, Louis Otey, and friend Kerry Henderson.
The three, who are world-class opera singers, had put together a three-day voice festival in August in the park down the street. Since then, Todaro, who volunteers as director of the Phoenicia Community Choir, has been hard at work with the group of 30 or more singers preparing Christmas carols to perform.
The caroling will be an outdoor prelude to a concert of music from the 16th and 17th centuries at the St. Francis de Sales Church on Main Street at 6:30 p.m. Thursday, featuring the festival’s founders and friends in a vocal ensemble called Syntagma Musicum.
During the caroling, there will be a tree lighting at Mama’s Boy and a bonfire. All are encouraged to bring musical instruments and warm clothes and join in the fun. Continued...
Reader Comments »
View reader comments (0) » Comment on this story »
“We’re giving out free cookies and hot cider,” Koegel said.

Correspondent
PHOENICIA — The center of this town of Shandaken hamlet will be transformed into something more like the North Pole this week thanks to a group of local business leaders.
An outdoor Christmas party is scheduled to begin at 4:30 p.m. Thursday on what has become the unofficial village square — the now wide-open space where the Phoenicia Hotel stood until burning to the ground three years ago.
The property, at the corner of Main and Church streets, in the middle of Phoenicia’s business district, was purchased and cleaned up by local entrepreneur Declan Feehan, who left a deck, a gazebo and a small cottage, which were the only structures spared by the flames.
Michael Koegel leased the property last summer and transformed those remaining structures into Mama’s Boy Café and Espresso Bar.
Koegel said the idea for Thursday’s festivities came about naturally when he and other organizers began brainstorming in the fall.
“We talked to a bunch of people — mostly merchants and some community-minded people, and we were looking for ways to promote Phoenicia,” he said. “One of the things quickly decided was that we wanted to do something for Christmas. Then we realized that Maria (Todaro) already had this caroling thing set up.”
Todaro is a co-founder of the Phoenicia Festival of the Voice, along with her husband, Louis Otey, and friend Kerry Henderson.
The three, who are world-class opera singers, had put together a three-day voice festival in August in the park down the street. Since then, Todaro, who volunteers as director of the Phoenicia Community Choir, has been hard at work with the group of 30 or more singers preparing Christmas carols to perform.
The caroling will be an outdoor prelude to a concert of music from the 16th and 17th centuries at the St. Francis de Sales Church on Main Street at 6:30 p.m. Thursday, featuring the festival’s founders and friends in a vocal ensemble called Syntagma Musicum.
During the caroling, there will be a tree lighting at Mama’s Boy and a bonfire. All are encouraged to bring musical instruments and warm clothes and join in the fun.
“We’re giving out free cookies and hot cider,” Koegel said.

description.hltext_display: インテル、レオナルドが後任か ベニテス解任は近い？
description.content: ［Goal.com］ ラファエル・ベニテス監督の去就が大きく騒がれているインテル。同監督は２０日、スペイン『オンダ・セロ』に対し、「解任されていない。私はまだインテルの指揮官だと感じている」と話したが、メディアはインテルが同監督に別れを告げるのは確実と見ている。イタリア『コッリエレ・デッロ・スポルト』などは２１日、ベニテス監督がクラブ・ワールドカップ優勝直後、クラブに対して不満ととれる発言でイメージを損ねたとして、補償金に関して法的措置を取る可能性もあると伝えた。一方で、ベニテス監督の代理人であるキロン氏は、「今日（２１日）はまだ誰からも連絡を受けておらず、モラッティ会長と会う予定もない。クラブが常に向上していくために、ベニテスはインテルで仕事を続けたいと願っているよ」とコメント。モラッティ会長と解任について話すことを否定している。だが、『トゥットスポルト』をはじめとするイタリアメディアは２１日、インテルが後任として元ミランのレオナルド監督を迎えることが有力になったと報道。モラッティ会長は同日、オフィスでマルコ・ブランカＴＤ（テクニカルディレクター）やリナルド・ゲルフィ副会長、ピエロ・アウジリオＳＤ（スポーツディレクター）らクラブの首脳陣とサミットを開催している。モラッティ会長は会議終了後、「ほかの監督たちとのコンタクトは否定する」とコメント。現時点ではベニテス監督が指揮官だと述べ、レオナルド監督との接触について問われると、「冗談はやめよう」と答えているのだが？

description.hltext_display: •離婚後住娘家 老媽嫌我給錢少追著我罵
description.content:
http://www.tianshannet.com 天山網 2010年12月22日 11:54:58 我來說兩句
更換背景顏色︰
更改文字大小︰
我離異帶個女兒生活，目前一直住在我媽家。我每個月都給我媽生活費，從一開始的1200到現在每個月2000元，可我媽老是追著我罵，還經常和我姨媽說我花光了她的錢。
我在一個小縣城里工作，我每個月的工資只有三千。我離異帶個女兒生活，目前一直住在我媽家。
從05年離婚開始，我每個月都給我媽生活費，從一開始的1200到現在每個月2000元，剩下不到1千是我和我女兒一個月的生活費。
相比較我身邊的一些朋友，人家家庭和睦，買房買車的，我的生活是屬于比較差一點的。所以我媽經常罵我沒出息，我有時候和我的朋友，或幾個表姐表弟出去吃一次飯，我媽就罵我敗家。所以我和我媽的關系一直不怎麼好，但是生活費我從沒有少給過。
有時候心情不好，我就和我表姐訴訴苦。然後我表姐就會去勸我媽，希望她可以想開點，不要什麼都來管我。然後我媽就說我沒良心，說我在外人面前說她的壞話，說我想她死，搞得我現在真的很怕回家。
我真的很討厭我媽老是追著我罵，還經常和我姨媽說我花光了她的錢，其實我每月給2000的生活費，然後我每天也只在家吃一餐的，怎麼算都是有多的。
現在別人都以為我很不好，都以為我是啃老的，心里很的很累。

description.hltext_display: Adeco Bureba ha distribuido más de 2,2 millones de euros del Leadercal
description.content:
Medio centenar de proyectos han contado durante este año del respaldo del grupo
Mie, 22/12/2010
GERARDO GONZÁLEZ / Briviesca
El grupo de acción local Adeco Bureba cerrará el presente año con una importante cifra de proyectos que han contado con ayudas de los fondos Leadercal que gestiona.
Así en los últimos datos disponibles un total de cincuenta proyectos han recibido el visto bueno de la Junta Directiva que aprobó las ayudas solicitadas.
Con estas ayudas, el importe total aprobado por el grupo de desarrollo rural a través del Leadercal asciende a 2.186.677,07 euros, un 47,7% de los fondos disponibles.
Esta elevada cifra tiene su origen en el hecho de que Adeco Bureba contaba con una importante cifra de proyectos presentados con anterioridad a la llegada de los fondos en lista de espera.
Según las previsiones en el año próximo y hasta la finalización del programa tanto el número de proyectos como de ayudas se ralentizará máxime en la actual situación de dificultades de financiación.
Por su filosofía, estas ayudas especiales para el desarrollo rural han de contar con una aportación privada de importancia para que ejerza el deseado efecto multiplicador en el medio rural.
Esto hace que la inversión global aparejada a los proyectos aprobados hasta ahora será de casi 4,2 millones de euros.
En este apartado destacan los servicios básicos 1,3 millones de inversión, Actividades turísticas, 1 millón, patrimonio rural, 0,9 euros y microempresas, 0,6 euros.
Dentro del programa el grupo de acción local tiene asignados 4.580.900 euros importe al que debe sumarse la aportación de la Diputación Provincial.
El ámbito de actuación del programa Leadercal se extiende desde la Merindad de Río Ubierna hasta el Condado de Treviño, pasando por la comarca de La Bureba y los valles del Ebro, Oca, Tirón y Las Navas. En total ocupa una extensión superior a los 2.300 kilómetros cuadrados dividida en 79 municipios con una población superior a los 21.000 habitantes.
Esto hace del grupo de acción local Adeco Bureba un auténtico motor para el desarrollo de diferentes zonas geográficas tal y como quedó demostrado con el programa precedente.
De hecho la cifra de asociados ha experimentado un notable incremento con la llegada del nuevo programa aumentando de 91 a 146 los socios del grupo tras los cambios realizados para incrementar la participación dentro del colectivo.
El objetivo de ofrecer un nivel de transparencia para el demandante de la ayuda llevó a establecer el principio de que cualquier emprendedor no precisara de un desplazamiento superior a los treinta kilómetros dentro del territorio.
Así se organizan visitas fechadas cada mes en Treviño, Sotopalacios y Belorado, con el apoyo de los ayuntamientos de las tres localidades, que han cedido espacio donde el gerente del grupo atiende y tramita los expedientes que se presentan.

description.hltext_display: Edinburgh's Hogmanay sells out
description.content:
Tickets for the Concert in the Gardens and The Keilidh have all gone.
216746
Biffy Clyro: Headlining the stage at this year's celebrations
Tickets to see Scots band Biffy Clyro at Edinburgh’s Hogmanay have sold out with just ten days left until they appear on stage.
They are set to play at the Concert in the Gardens along with The Charlatans and Billy Bragg.
The Ayrshire trio – currently in Singapore – are looking forward to helping revellers bring in the New Year in Princes Street Gardens.
The band’s manager, Dee Bhal, said: “This is the icing on the cake for what has been a brilliant year for the band and their fans – it?s a great way for all of us to bring in 2011!”
Tickets for The Keilidh have also sold out. Revellers can still get entrance to the Street Party where Newtoun Faulkner and The Coral will be playing.
Pete Irvine, Organiser of Edinburgh?s Hogmanay, said “With Biffy Clyro as our headline act, we knew this event was going to be very popular, and are delighted that all the tickets have sold out so far ahead of the event.”
Tickets for all events can be purchased in person from the Edinburgh?s Hogmanay Box office, on-line or over the phone on 0844 894 2011.
